<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0">The 
            <choice>
              <sic>histroians</sic>
              <corr>historians</corr>
            </choice> work from the outer to the inner;</l>
<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0">from the house they infer the tenant of the house. It is the</l>
<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0">house they uncover; the chairs, the tables, the bills, the</l>

<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0">close 
            <choice>
              <sic>stolls</sic>
              <corr>stools</corr>
            </choice>, the spinning wheels, the tapestry.</l>
<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0">It is as if we were bidden to infer from a tweed suit,</l>

<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0">six hats, a fox terrier, and a silver 
            <choice>
              <sic>knovved</sic>
              <corr>knobbed</corr>
            </choice> walking stick</l>

<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0">the life and works of a novelist called <rs type="person" ref="../resources/annotations.xml#psn-hjam" key="James, Henry">
            <choice>
              <sic>Hnery james</sic>
              <corr>Henry James</corr>
            </choice></rs>.</l>

<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0">Save for 
            <choice>
              <sic>Vhaucer</sic>
              <corr>Chaucer</corr>
            </choice> and Lydgate and the voice of Anon singing</l>
<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0">at the back door the English might be a dumb race; a race</l>

<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0">of merchants, 
            <choice>
              <sic>s ldiers</sic>
              <corr>soldiers</corr>
            </choice>, 
            <choice>
              <sic>preists</sic>
              <corr>priests</corr>
            </choice> and builders who left
            <choice>
              <sic>nehind</sic>
              <corr>behind</corr>
            </choice></l>
<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0">them stone houses, cultivated fields and many churches and</l>
<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0">cathedrals. ; but no words. The great house is silent.</l>
<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0">Only the furniture remains, stiff and ornate, fantastic and</l>
<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0">uncushioned.</l>

<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0">At <rs type="place" ref="../resources/annotations.xml#psn-gorh" key="Gorhambury">Gorhambury</rs> for 
            <choice>
              <sic>instnace</sic>
              <corr>instance</corr>
            </choice> <rs type="person" ref="../resources/annotations.xml#psn-abac" key="Bacon, Ann">Lady Ann Bacon</rs></l>

<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0">sat at her table <choice>
            <sic>rwiting</sic>
            <corr>writing</corr>
          </choice> to <rs type="person" ref="../resources/annotations.xml#psn-fbac" key="Bacon, Francis">her son</rs>. Her <choice>
            <sic>lettres</sic>
            <corr>letters</corr>
          </choice> <add hand="ms" place="above">—compare them with</add> might have</l>

<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0">
            <choice>
              <sic>veen</sic>
              <corr>been</corr>
            </choice> sermons from the <choice>

<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0">
            <choice>

              <corr>involved</corr>
            </choice> and evasive. She is a counsellor admonishing a sub</l>

              <corr>she</corr>

            <choice>

<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0">the dangers and 
            <choice>
              <sic>decits</sic>
              <corr>deceits</corr>
            </choice> of the world; and the awfuless of</l>

<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0">God. Greek and Latin come to her pen as easily as 
            <choice>
              <sic> nglish</sic>
              <corr>English</corr>
            </choice>.</l>
<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0">If she has to descend to the actual object--a basket of</l>

<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0">strawberries--it is with 
            <choice>
              <sic>cirumlocuitions</sic>
              <corr>circumlocutions</corr>
            </choice> and dark</l>

            <choice>
              <sic>insiutaions</sic>
              <corr>insinuations</corr>
            </choice>. <quote source="#" rend="inline">"I have sent them by the boy of my kitchen,</quote></l>
